channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Biden vows to end 'chapter of American darkness'
Hits and misses from final night of the Democratic National Convention
item.description: The Democratic National Convention is now officially over.

item.title: Joe Biden's DNC speech: Full video
item.description: During his speech at the 2020 Democratic National Convention, Joe Biden accepts the nomination to be the 2020 Democratic presidential nominee and talked about his vision to beat Donald Trump in the 2020 presidential election. Watch more convention videos here.

item.title: Watch highlights from the final night of the Democratic National Convention
Republican strategist gets emotional over DNC moment
item.description: CNN Republican strategist Scott Jennings says the highlight of the fourth night of the DNC was the story of a 13-year-old boy overcoming the insecurity of his stutter.

item.title: Trump is in overdrive to try to outshine the DNC
New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern wants to eliminate coronavirus. Is she setting herself up to fail?
item.description: In mid-March, as the coronavirus pandemic began to take hold in Europe and the United States, New Zealand's Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern presented her country with a choice.

item.title: It's official -- citizens in China's capital don't have to wear masks outside anymore
Satellite photos appear to show Chinese submarine using underground base
Scientists have more historically bad news about Greenland
item.description: Greenland's ice sheet melted more last year than any year previously recorded, according to a new study, in another sign of the devastating impacts of a warming planet.

item.title: Brawl erupts on airplane over masks
item.description: Airline passengers brawl over seats and masks. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the blow-by-blow account.

item.title: Ex-Trump adviser Steve Bannon pleads not guilty after arrest on fraud charges
Kim Jong Un delegates some powers to sister, South Korean intelligence says
item.description: Kim Jong Un has reportedly given his sister, Kim Yo Jong, partial authority to oversee "general state affairs" in order to ease the North Korean leader's workload, according to South Korean intelligence.

item.title: Sweden records highest death tally in 150 years in first half of 2020
item.description: Sweden recorded its highest death tally in 150 years for the first half of 2020, according to the country's official statistics office.

item.title: Teen shares how Joe Biden helped him with his stutter
item.description: During the 2020 Democratic National Convention, Brayden Harrington, 13, shares how meeting Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden gave him confidence to work through his stutter.

item.title: US isolated as allies and opponents reject its bid to snapback UN sanctions on Iran
item.description: The Trump administration was left isolated on the world stage as foreign allies and competitors alike rejected its demand to restore UN sanctions on Iran Thursday.

item.title: Stephen Curry laughs at daughter's presidential nominee guess
item.description: During the Democratic National Convention, Stephen and Ayesha Curry have a candid conversation with their daughters Ryan and Riley about the importance of voting ahead of the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Kushner's secret push to sell F-35 jets to UAE causes confusion and frustration
item.description: A secret push by President Donald Trump's senior adviser Jared Kushner to sell advanced arms -- including F-35 stealth fighter jets -- to the United Arab Emirates has caused confusion and frustration among agencies and congressional committees that would normally be involved in such a sale but have been left in the dark.

item.title: How one hotel helped unleash Australia's new outbreak
item.description: More than 90% of new Covid-19 cases in Australia's state of Victoria can be traced back to one quarantine hotel, officials say. The state has launched a judicial inquiry into what went wrong in the quarantine hotels that helped unleash a fresh outbreak in the state. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: California fires turn deadly as evacuees worry about their homes, Covid-19, and excessive heat
item.description: California's lightning-sparked infernos are torching wide swaths of the state, killing a utility worker, demolishing homes and forcing people to evacuate in the sweltering heat during a pandemic.

item.title: Scientists say they've figured the odds of catching Covid on a plane
item.description: Sitting squeezed between a number of strangers on board an aircraft might feel like a risky position during these uncertain times.

item.title: These variables affect whether you live, die or get help during the pandemic
item.description: As the US continues to grapple with the dual crises of coronavirus and racism, two things have become clear: People of color are being hit hardest by the virus, and systemic inequities are largely to blame.

item.title: Julia Louis-Dreyfus' DNC satire: Awkward or funny?
item.description: "Veep" and "Seinfeld" star Julia Louis-Dreyfus emceed the final night of the Democratic National Convention in the lead up to Joe Biden officially accepting the Democratic presidential nomination.

item.title: Alaskan salmon are decreasing in size thanks to climate change and competition, study says
item.description: Alaskan salmon are getting smaller due to climate change and competition, according to a new study.

item.title: Many leaders used Covid as cover to dent democracy. Trump may be the first to openly admit it
item.description: In the months since Covid-19 swept the globe, leaders the world over have been accused of exploiting the pandemic for political gain while laying waste to democratic norms. Few, if any, have gone as far as to reveal those plans publicly.

item.title: Hear Dr. Gupta's pointed message to Georgia's governor
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta responds to Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp's latest comments regarding coronavirus information being released, in which Kemp called the leaked report "pandemic politics."

item.title: France offers asylum to Russian opposition leader after suspected poisoning
Republicans are suing to stop people from voting the way Trump did
item.description: The Republican Party is going court this year to stop voters from using the same method President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump used this week: casting mail-in votes with help from a designated contact, who is authorized to pick up and drop off the ballots.

item.title: CNN team was tracked by Russian operatives, investigation shows
item.description: A new investigation has found evidence that CNN journalists in the Central African Republic (CAR) last year were subject to constant surveillance by a team of Russian operatives.

item.title: Gold diggers unearth historic nuggets
item.description: Gold diggers in southern Australia have found two huge nuggets worth $350,000 AUD ($250,000 USD) in historic goldfields.

item.title: The BlackBerry is coming back
item.description: BlackBerry has been left for dead countless times over the past decade, but it refuses to go away. Two years after the last (we thought) BlackBerry phone, the BlackBerry logo will appear once again on a smartphone, complete with its famous, honest-to-goodness, physical QWERTY keyboard.

item.title: Airbnb says parties are now banned
item.description: Addressing an ongoing problem with unauthorized parties at Airbnb listings that has been aggravated by the pandemic and public health risks, the rental behemoth issued a ban Thursday on parties at properties worldwide.

item.title: Rojak: The evolution of Singapore's favorite salad
item.description: From chilli crabs to chicken rice, char kway teow to laksa, Singapore's open-air hawker markets are a must-visit destination for those in search of the rich yet cheap offerings the Little Red Dot is known for.

item.title: 'Technology has made my life worth living': Artist paints with her eyes
item.description: London-based artist Sarah Ezekiel has won international recognition for her vivid, life-affirming images. But her work is all the more remarkable for the fact that she has a medical condition that has left her unable to move her arms.

item.title: Robot friends: Why people talk to chatbots in times of trouble
item.description: During the depths of winter, temperatures in Burlington, Vermont, a state in the US Northeast, can drop far below freezing. Blizzards howl and the snow creeps up to knee level.

item.title: A blind musician can feel a conductor's movements, thanks to a high-tech baton
item.description: When Kyungho Jeon was young, he dreamed of playing in an orchestra, but his teachers feared it would be too difficult -- not because he lacked musical talent, but because he was born blind, and couldn't see a conductor's movements to follow their cues.

item.title: Volkswagen now has another electric SUV to take on Tesla
item.description: Production has started in Germany on the first electric SUV from the Volkswagen brand, marking the latest push by the world's largest carmaker into cleaner vehicles.

item.title: The world's largest painting is being made in a Dubai hotel ballroom by this artist
item.description: A British artist has taken over the ballroom of a luxury hotel in Dubai to produce the largest painting ever created on canvas.

item.title: The 13-year-old aiming to become Ferrari's first female Formula 1 driver
item.description: "My favorite part of racing is the speed."

item.title: How Tokyo's massive lost & found works
item.description: The bad news—you lost your wallet in Tokyo. The good news—chances are good you will get it back, along with all the cash tucked inside. In Japan, residents are diligent about making sure what's lost is found and returned to its rightful owner. This is how the city's stunningly efficient Lost & Found system works.

item.title: World's second 'Making of Harry Potter' attraction to open
item.description: Great news for Japan-based muggles in need of a bit more magic in their lives -- a new 30,000-square-meter Harry Potter attraction is coming to Tokyo.

item.title: Jim Belushi believes this would have saved his brother John
item.description: Actor Jim Belushi is so pro-cannabis that he's now in the industry and says he believes his brother John would still be alive if he had been a "pot head."

item.title: Google Maps has a new, more colorful look
item.description: Google Maps just unveiled its latest redesign. The new maps are more colorful and show more details so users can better understand what kind of terrain they're looking at.

item.title: Biden vows to end 'chapter of American darkness'
In photos: The Democratic National Convention
item.description: The Democratic National Convention looked much different than any convention we have ever seen.

item.title: 8 takeaways from the DNC's final night
item.description: The speech Joe Biden delivered Thursday night was one he'd waited a political lifetime to make. And his words touched on the highs and lows of the odyssey that led him there.

item.title: Biden takes on Trump-era traumas
item.description: If Joe Biden becomes the 46th American President, his speech accepting the Democratic presidential nomination on Thursday night will be seen as the moment when the destiny of a man and his nation converged.

item.title: How Biden just made Trump's job a lot tougher
item.description: CNN contributors weigh in with short takes on the fourth night of the Democratic National Convention's biggest moments and speeches. The views expressed in these commentaries are those of the authors.

item.title: Bannon pleads not guilty to fraud charges
item.description: • Analysis: Bannon's arrest is a fitting symbol for the Trump era • Opinion: Bannon's troubles are just beginning

item.title: USPS email tells managers not to reconnect sorting machines
item.description: While Postmaster General Louis DeJoy may be suspending changes to postal service operations, it doesn't necessarily mean machines that had been removed will be put back in use, according to an email obtained by CNN.
